word: der Ps, die There seems to be a mistake in the last example. the singular "der der ps" does not have a corresponding plural form.
definition: A commonly used abbreviation that typically appears at the end of a written or typed message, often followed by a colon. It is frequently employed to add an additional remark or thought after the main content of the message has been concluded.

examples.german: PS: Bitte vergiss nicht, mir die Unterlagen zuzuschicken.
examples.english: P.S.: Please don't forget to send me the documents.

examples.german: Ich habe ihm eine PS zu seinem Geburtstag geschickt.
examples.english: I sent him a P.S. for his birthday.

examples.german: PS: Denk daran, den Müll rauszubringen.
examples.english: P.S.: Remember to take out the trash.

examples.german: Sie hat mir eine PS zu ihrem Brief hinzugefügt.
examples.english: She added a P.S. to her letter.

examples.german: PS: Ich freue mich schon auf unser Treffen nächste Woche.
examples.english: P.S.: I'm looking forward to our meeting next week.
